snippet.title: HQ REMASTER: SENGOKU-CYBER FUJIMARU JIGOKUHEN (PSX/PS1) OPENING MOVIE
snippet.description:
The exotic theme song with drum'n'bass rhythm and the ninja images are a very interesting combination. It is performed by Deborah Harry.

This game was only released in Japan. The true ending cannot be seen without a strategy book. Despite such difficulties, the fascinating story and characters made it a cult favourite.

It is regrettable that there is no possibility of developing a remake of the game, as the game can be played even today if the game design is improved and the difficult riddles are tweaked.

▼ from Wikipedia
Japanese-style simulation RPG centred on ninjas at the end of the Sengoku period.
Unlike the historical facts, the world is depicted as one in which the ninja have a stronger influence than the samurai, and although it is the Warring States period, modern weapons such as missiles, lasers and verniers appear as 'karakuri', and the story develops as a Warring States fantasy.

▼Data
Platform: PS1/PSX (PlayStation)
Developer: PANDORA BOX
Publisher: SCE (SONY COMPUTER ENTERTAINMENT)
Release: 1995
